Key Findings

  • The Adults and Prevention Services department has the largest budget, with a total spend of £412.4M, accounting for 23.8% of the council's total expenditure.
  • The Resources department has a budget of £263.4M, which is 15.2% of the total spend, making it the second-largest department in terms of expenditure.
  • The top three departments by spend are Adults and Prevention Services (£412.4M), Resources (£263.4M), and Schools and Education DSG (£259.1M), which together account for 53.9% of the council's total spend.

Departmental Spending Breakdown

The spending data for Blackburn with Darwen Borough Council reveals a clear picture of where the council's resources are being allocated. The Adults and Prevention Services department has the largest budget, with a total spend of £412.4M, which is 23.8% of the council's total expenditure. This department is responsible for providing services to vulnerable adults, including social care and support.

In contrast, the Resources department has a budget of £263.4M, which is 15.2% of the total spend. This department is responsible for providing support services to the rest of the council, including finance, human resources, and IT. The Schools and Education DSG department has a budget of £259.1M, which is 15.0% of the total spend, making it the third-largest department in terms of expenditure.

The following table shows the top 5 departments by spend, along with their corresponding percentages of the total spend:
Department Amount % of Total
Adults and Prevention Services £412.4M 23.8%
Resources £263.4M 15.2%
Schools and Education DSG £259.1M 15.0%

Growth and Development £131.1M 7.6%

Smaller Departments

The smaller departments, such as Environmental Services and Public Health and Wellbeing, have significantly smaller budgets. The Environmental Services department has a budget of £82.9M, which is 4.8% of the total spend, while the Public Health and Wellbeing department has a budget of £82.2M, which is 4.7% of the total spend. These departments are responsible for providing important services to the community, including waste management and public health initiatives.

The following departments have budgets of less than £100M: Schools and Education non DSG (£73.8M), Finance and Governance (£65.3M), and Corporate (£53.9M). These departments are responsible for providing support services to the rest of the council, including education, finance, and corporate services.

What You Can Do

  • Submit a Freedom of Information request to Blackburn with Darwen Borough Council about the spending breakdown of the Adults and Prevention Services department.
  • Attend council committee meetings, which are open to the public, to learn more about the council's spending decisions.
  • Check the council's published contracts register to see which suppliers are providing goods and services to the council.
  • Write to your local councillor about your concerns regarding the council's spending priorities.
  • Visit aidoge.co.uk to explore the full spending data and learn more about how the council is allocating its resources.
This article is based on Blackburn with Darwen Borough Council's published spending data covering 2020/21 to 2025/26. All figures are drawn directly from transactions published under the Local Government Transparency Code. Analysis by AI DOGE.
